studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: Isatuximab + Atezolizumab
arms.description: Participants receive isatuximab (Days 1, 8, 15 in Cycle 1, then Day 1 of subsequent cycles) in combination with atezolizumab (Day 1 of each 21-day cycle) administered intravenously

studyCohorts.name: Cohort SCCHN
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck

studyCohorts.name: Cohort E
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with modified treatment schedule (evaluation not applicable for certain assessments)

studyInterventions.name: Isatuximab
studyInterventions.description: Anti-CD38 monoclonal antibody administered as IV infusion

studyInterventions.name: Atezolizumab
studyInterventions.description: Anti-PD-L1 monoclonal antibody administered as IV infusion in combination with isatuximab

encounters.name: EOT 30 (7) days after last IMPs admin
Safety At 60 (7) days after last IMPs admin
Safety At 90 (7) days after last IMPs admin

activities.name: Height (at baseline only) /Weight/ ECOG (HCC,SCCHN,EOC) or Karnofsky PS (GBM)
activities.description: Height (at baseline only) /Weight/ ECOG (HCC,SCCHN,EOC) or Karnofsky PS (GBM)

activities.name: Pregnancy test (WOCBP only)
activities.description: Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result within 7 days prior to first IMP administration.

activities.name: Blood Typing Interference Test
activities.description: Blood Typing Interference Test - Before each transfusion.

activities.name: Serology HBV and HCV (for HCC only)
activities.description: Serology HBV and HCV (for HCC only)

activities.name: Urinalysis (at baseline and if required) /urine dipstick
activities.description: Urinalysis (at baseline and if required) /urine dipstick

activities.name: Prior/Concomitant Medication
activities.description: Prior/Concomitant Medication - within 14 days prior to first dose, continuously throughout period

notes.text: b Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result within 7 days prior to first IMP administration.
c evaluation not applicable for Cohort E

indications.name: Solid Tumors (HCC, SCCHN, EOC, GBM)
indications.description: Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC), Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck (SCCHN), Epithelial Ovarian Cancer (EOC), Glioblastoma (GBM)

abbreviations.expandedText: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

commentAnnotations.text: Informed consent may be signed prior to D -28
Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result within 7 days prior to first IMP administration
Evaluation not applicable for Cohort E
Refer to the laboratory manual for sample collection, processing and shipping
Isatuximab PK or ADA predose samples should be collected before isatuximab administration and at the same time as atezolizumab predose samples when applicable
Atezolizumab sample collected strictly before the start of atezolizumab infusion (during treatment phase)
P04 sample must be collected even if the participant withdraws the study without receiving the second administration of isatuximab

After start of study treatment, if 1 drug is prematurely discontinued, ADA samples for this drug will be collected and tested on Day 1 of the 2 next cycles. The ADA sample collection for other drug should be done as planned
Biomarker blood draw may be performed within 1 working day prior to IMP administration
Mandatory for all GBM participants. For HCC, SCCHN, and EOC participants, provision of adequate archival tumor tissue is allowed to replace mandatory baseline biopsy
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Exploratory Biomarker Flow Chart - Archival Tumor Tissue

commentAnnotations.text: At least 1 tumor core is required, but 3 cores are optimal. Refer to Laboratory Manual for details
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Exploratory Biomarker Flow Chart - Tumor Biopsy

commentAnnotations.text: Only Phase 2 Stage 2 participants, if sufficient clinical response is observable in Phase 1 and Phase 2 Stage 1 participants
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Exploratory Biomarker Flow Chart - Adaptive Immunity

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Amended Clinical Trial Protocol 05 for ACT15377-isatuximab study

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated Schedule of Activities table with detailed visit windows and assessment timing
Physical examination timing clarified with reference to Section 8.2.1
Vital signs and resting O2 saturation requirements specified for SCCHN cohort
Laboratory assessment schedule updated including blood chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and blood typing interference test
Disease assessment imaging schedule specified for different tumor types (HCC, SCCHN, EOC, GBM)

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Clarification of assessment schedules and visit windows for different tumor cohorts
Specification of cohort-specific requirements (e.g., Cohort E evaluation exceptions, SCCHN-specific O2 saturation monitoring)
Addition of blood typing interference test requirements due to isatuximab interference with blood compatibility testing

studyChanges.afterText: Physical examination: X (<7days prior to first dose) during screening D-14 to D-1
studyChanges.summary: Clarified physical examination must be performed within 7 days prior to first dose during screening

studyChanges.afterText: Resting O2 saturation for SCCHN: X at screening and throughout treatment phase
studyChanges.summary: Added resting O2 saturation monitoring requirement specifically for SCCHN cohort

studyChanges.afterText: Blood Typing Interference Test: X at screening D-14 to D-1, Cycle 2 Day 1 only, and before each transfusion
studyChanges.summary: Specified blood typing interference test schedule including requirement before each transfusion

studyChanges.afterText: Pregnancy test: every 307 days until 5 months after last dose of study treatment during survival follow-up
studyChanges.summary: Extended pregnancy testing requirement to 5 months after last dose during survival follow-up

studyChanges.afterText: CT/MRI (for HCC, SCCHN, and EOC): X (Weeks 9, 18, 27, and then every 12 weeks); Brain MRI (for GBM only): X (Weeks 6, 12, 18, 24, and then every 9 weeks)
studyChanges.summary: Specified different imaging schedules for solid tumors versus GBM

studyChanges.afterText: c evaluation not applicable for Cohort E
studyChanges.summary: Added footnote clarifying that certain evaluations on D8 and D15 are not applicable for Cohort E
